intro: Gayophytum minutum, commonly known as the dwarf gayophytum, is a small, flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces delicate, yellow flowers that are typically less than an inch in diameter. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
